headline: Sen. Warnock reports $9.8M raised to Herschel Walker's $5.4M
sentences:
Update at 12:55 p.m.
Democratic Sen. Raphael Warnocks campaign said Wednesday that he raised a hefty $9.8 million in the last quarter of 2021, nearly double the fundraising haul reported by the leading Republican contender for his seat, former football star Herschel Walker.

Republicans had long dominated statewide races in Georgia until 2020, when the state helped elect Joe Biden to the presidency and handed Democrats control of the Senate by electing Warnock and fellow Democrat Jon Ossoff in a January 2021 runoff.

An investigation by The Associated Press in July revealed accusations that Walker repeatedly threatened his ex-wifes life, exaggerated claims of financial success and alarmed business associates with unpredictable behavior.
He has to defend his seat this fall after winning a special election in 2020 to fill the unexpired term of Republican Sen. Johnny Isakson, who stepped down because of failing health.
A statement by Warnocks campaign said his fourth-quarter fundraising total was his biggest yet, boosted by 130,000 individual donors whose average contribution was $43.
Gary Black serves as Georgias agriculture commissioner, Latham Saddler is a Navy veteran and former bank executive, and Kelvin King owns a construction company.
It said he has raised nearly $10 million total since entering the race in August but did not disclose how much cash he still had in the bank as of Dec. 31.
Though a political newcomer, Walker is among Georgias best-known sports heroes for his football career at the University of Georgia and in the NFL.
Hes a Black conservative who has been endorsed by former President Donald Trump, a longtime friend, and Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell.
Further details wont be available until Warnock and Walker file their quarterly fundraising reports with the Federal Election Commission.
Their campaigns have not yet filed fourth-quarter fundraising reports and did not immediately respond to email messages Wednesday.
Walkers campaign said more than 44,000 people in all 50 states made donations to the Republican candidate in the fourth-quarter.
A Walker campaign spokeswoman, Mallory Blount, dismissed Blacks criticism as a desperate move by a struggling candidate.
In the GOP primary for the Senate seat, Walker faces at least three other Republicans who have declared candidacies.
Walkers campaign said in a statement Wednesday that he raised $5.4 million in the three-month period ending Dec. 31.
Georgia will be a key battleground in the 2022 midterm elections to determine which party controls the U.S. Senate.
Black has publicly questioned Walkers fitness to serve in the Senate, citing his rivals turbulent personal history.
Walker has a lengthy history of mental health struggles, much of which he detailed in his autobiography.
Warnock raised more than $125 million for his 2020 Senate race, according to FEC reports.
The campaign said Warnock ended the quarter with $23 million in cash on hand.
Martin Luther King Jr. preached, became Georgias first Black U.S. senator.
In the 2022 campaign cycle, he had raised $44 million as of Sept. 30.
Warnock, pastor of the Atlanta church where the Rev.
The deadline for Senate candidates is Monday.
Isakson died in December.
